page.description: Internal use only. Describes a reference to a table.

section.description: Internal use only. The SQL::Query::SelectTableReference object describes a reference to a table. It occurs in the FROM clause or in a JOIN clause. At a low level, you can use this object to build up a complete query without ever calling a parse method.
section.example: dim Query as SQL::Query dim MyTable as SQL::Query::SelectTableReference MyTable.Name = "customer" MyTable.Alias = "cust" Query.Table.Add(MyTable)

property.name: Alias
property.description: Read Write. A unique name for the table. This is used in cases where two tables have defined same column name or when a table is joined to itself.

property.name: Join
property.description: Read Write. A list of join clauses. Note: The join object includes a property that is a table reference itself. This can nest multiple levels.

property.name: Name
property.description: Read Write. The base name of the table.

property.name: Owner
property.description: Read Write. The name of the table owner. Note: Schema is not supported yet.
